Biography: Hazem Ben-Gacem is head of Corporate Investment - Europe as well as Corporate Investment - Technology. Hazem has been with Investcorp since 1994 and is currently a board director of Ceme, Fleetmatics, kgb and Skrill. Prior to joining Investcorp, Hazem was a member of Credit Suisse First Boston's mergers and acquisitions team in New York. Hazem holds a BA (Hons) in Economics from Harvard University. He also serves on the Dean's Council for the Harvard Kennedy School of Government.
A strategy professional with operational experience growing brands in both emerging and developed markets. Interests include consumer products and early stage investments.

Primary Organization: Investment and Development Office Government of Ras Al Khaimah
Current Organizations: Investment and Development Office Government of Ras Al Khaimah

Biography: Murat Tasci founded Actus Partners, a global management consultancy company based in London, focused on Private Equity and Venture Capital solutions. Prior to that, he was a VP at Investcorp and Senior Director in Private Equity at GFH Financial Group. Murat holds a Masters in Financial Engineering and a BA in Management, both from Bogazici University, Istanbul. Murat has also completed a Private Equity Executive Masterclass at the London Business School, holds an advanced level and derivatives certificate from the Capital Markets Board of Turkey.

Najla Al Shirawi has more than 21 years of investment banking experience. Having been part of SICO since 1997, she was appointed CEO in 2014 following her appointment as deputy CEO in 2013. Najla served with Geneva-based Dar Al-Maal Al-Islami Trust, where she established private banking operations for the Group in the Gulf region. Najla is a Board member at the Bahrain Economic Board (EDB) and a Chairperson on the Board of Directors for two SICO subsidiaries: SICO Funds Services Company (SFS) in Bahrain and SICO Financial Brokerage in Abu Dhabi. She is also an Independent Board Member of Eskan Bank BSC(c), Bahrain and a Board Member of the Deposit Protection Scheme, Bahrain, the Bahrain Associations of Banks, and the Bahrain Institute of Banking and Finance. She holds an MBA and a BA in Civil Engineering from University of Bahrain.

Hasan Haider is currently the Chief Executive Officer at Tenmou - the first Business Angels Company in Bahrain. He is committed, driven and dedicated to developing a start-up culture in Bahrain and helping other entrepreneurs make their ideas into a reality. Hasan started his entrepreneurial activities by launching FILM2GO, an innovative start-up venture that provides an online DVD rentals, with free delivery and pickup. Hasan also has several years of investment experience, most recently as a Portfolio Manager at SICO Investment Bank. Graduated with a BSc(Hon) in Economics from University College London (UCL), and is a CFA Level 2 Candidate. Hasan is also an active member of the Rotary Club of Adliya, and an Alumni member of the Ship for World Youth Alumni Association Bahrain, a Japanese government sponsored youth development and exchange program.

Born in 1964, Emanuele Angelidis holds a BSc. in Electronic Engineering from the Polytechnic of Milan and subsequently achieved a diploma in Business Management from SDA Bocconi and an Advanced Management Program from Kellogg School of Management of Chicago. After having started his career in Italtel Telecomunicazioni, in 1994 he took part in the start-up and development of Omnitel, latterly Vodafone Italy. In 1999 he co-founded and participated in the development of Fastweb as CEO. In 2004 he started focussing on international projects, initially in London as CEO of Bulldog Communications and later as an investor, CEO and Board Member of several initiatives including Erenis in Paris, On Telecoms in Athens, SyQic in Singapore, and Viacloud in London. In June 2014 he became the CEO at Breed Reply Ltd, an advanced incubator focussed on accelerating the growth of start-up businesses that develop products and innovative services in the Internet of Things market.

Primary Job Title: Managing Director & Head of Corporate Investment
Biography: James Tanner joined Investcorp in 2008 and is head of Corporate Investment - MENA.  Prior to joining Investcorp, James was Managing Director and a member of the Board of Morley Fund Management, the leading London-based investment house, now Aviva Investors.  Previous roles include managing director, Global Markets at HSBC in London for two years and a 19 year career at Morgan Stanley in London, New York and Hong Kong where his roles included serving as CEO of Morgan Stanley Investment Management, Europe, and COO of International Prime Brokerage Services.
Schools Attended: Indiana University, Kelley School of Business

Biography: Mr. Stergios Voskopoulos is the CEO of Kanoo Capital, the Investment Division within YBA Kanoo, one of the largest and oldest family conglomerates in the Middle East. As CEO of Kanoo Capital, Stergios is responsible for the active management of direct and indirect investments regionally and globally. He has worked in the Gulf Region for over 10 years, and has over 20 years of global experience in the areas of Asset Management, Private Equity and M&A, including AIG Global Investment Group, Barclays, Investcorp and Seera Investment Bank. Mr. Voskopoulos has also been a serial entrepreneur himself and a speaker in several global summits in topics around investment management, innovation, family offices, global affairs and business. He has an MBA in Finance & Investments from Zicklin School of Business in New York and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering from the University of Athens, he speaks six languages having lived and worked in seven countries.

Primary Job Title: Managing Director of Operations and Internal Controls
Biography: Ebrahim Hussain Ebrahim joined Investcorp in 1985 from Banque Paribas where he spent three years as manager, letter of credits and guarantees. Ebrahim holds an Advanced Diploma in Finance from the Bahrain Institute of Banking and Finance. He also studied data design and computer languages at Bahrain University and took part in the Gulf Executive Development Program at the University of Virginia.

Abdulla Almoayed is a serial entrepreneur and the founder and CEO of Almoayed Technologies, a privately-owned investment and digital infrastructure company serving governments and financial institutions across the MENA region. Mr.Almoayed spent 15 years in investment banking before establishing Almoayed Technologies - with a clear vision to help transform the MENA region into a world leading digital economy by investing in game-changing companies across Fintech, Healthcare, Education, Logistics, and Cybersecurity. As part of Almoayed Technologies, Abdulla founded Tarabut Gateway - the first company licensed to deliver open banking in the MENA region, and the leading provider of open banking infrastructure in MENA.
Schools Attended: London Business School, University of Westminster

Biography: Hadi AL Alawi is the chief executive officer at Al Hayat Group.

Mohammed Al-Shroogi joined Investcorp in 2009. As President of Gulf Business, he oversees all Investcorp's activities in the Gulf region. Mohammed joined Investcorp from Citigroup where he was Division Executive for the Middle East and North Africa region and CEO for the United Arab Emirates.  Mohammed had a 30 year career with Citigroup in Bahrain, London and the UAE. Amongst his many achievements at Citigroup was establishing Citibank Bahrain as a major trading room between Asia and Europe.  Mohammed holds a BA in Commerce from Kuwait University and attended the Executive Program at Harvard Business School.  He is a Member of the Bahrain Economic Development Board, a Member of the Board of Trustees at Bahrain University, a Member of the Board of the National US-Arab Chamber of Commerce in Washington D.C. and a Member of the Board of Injaz Al Arab.

Primary Job Title: Group Chief Executive Officer of Finance and Strategic Development
Biography: Sanjeev Baijal serves as Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Finance and Strategic Development at Commercial Bank of Iraq PSC. Mr. Baijal serves as Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Finance and Strategic Development at Ahli United Bank B.S.C. Mr. Baijal serves as Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Finance & Strategic Development at Al Hilal Life B.S.C. (alternative name Legal & General Gulf B.S.C.) Mr. Baijal serves as Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Finance, Operations and Information Technology at Ahli United Bank- Egypt S.A.E., a subsidiary of Ahli United Bank B.S.C. He served as Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Operations and IT at Ahli United Bank B.S.C. He served as Group Head of Finance at Ahli United Bank, Bahrain; and Financial Controller of Al-Ahli Commercial Bank, Bahrain. He worked at Ernst & Young, Bahrain and Price Waterhouse in India. He serves as Deputy Chairman at Legal and General Gulf B.S.C.(c) & Legal and General Gulf Takaful B.S.C.(c), Mr. Baijal has been Non-Independent Director of Ahli Bank S.A.O.G. since December 2007. He serves as a Director of AUB Investments (Cyprus Ltd). He has been a Non Executive Director of Ahli United Bank K.S.C.P. since 2005. He served as a Director of Kuwait and Middle East Financial Investment Company K.S.C.P. (alternative name Kuwait and Middle East Financial Investment Company K.S.C. (Closed)). He is a Member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), Associate Member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ACA), and Graduate Member of the Institute of Cost & Works Accountants of India. Mr. Baijal graduated from Loyola College in India.

Current Organizations: ARMADA DELIVERY SOLUTIONS, inagrab, Modus Capital

Biography: Rishi Kapoor is Investcorp’s Co-Chief Executive Officer, responsible for overseeing the Firm’s investment activities across North America, Europe and the Middle East, covering Corporate Investments, Real Estate Investments, Alternative Investment Solutions and Credit Management. He chairs the Firm's Investment Committees across its different product lines, as well as the Firm's Financial Risk Management Committee. Rishi joined Investcorp from Citigroup in 1992, and has held several positions at the Firm since then, including Chief Financial Officer from 2003 to 2015. During his tenure as Chief Financial Officer, Rishi spearheaded several public and private capital market transactions for Investcorp across global capital markets, including a listing of Investcorp's shares on the London Stock Exchange. Rishi was responsible for navigating the Firm through the Global Financial Crisis of 2008-09 through a timely and significant de-risking and de-leveraging of the balance sheet, raising additional capital, refinancing outstanding debt and arranging access to liquidity and capital on a revolving basis in support of the Firm's business model, thereby positioning Investcorp in a competitively advantageous position to recover and benefit from the opportunities coming out of the great recession. He was appointed Co-Chief Executive Officer of Investcorp in 2015, upon the founding Chief Executive Officer’s retirement. Rishi holds a Bachelors degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, and a Masters in Business Administration from Duke University.
Schools Attended: Duke University, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur

Biography: Sael Al Waary is a banker and technologist with a career spanning 35 years. He is currently Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Bank ABC Group, covering 15 countries across five continents. He is recognised for spearheading a number of Fintech innovations across the Middle East, in particular the establishment of ila Bank, a new digital mobile-only bank which will launch in Bahrain this year then Egypt and Jordan next year. He has a strong passion for FinTech, driving innovative products and services to enable greater financial inclusion across the region. He leverages his experience to impact banking in MENA in the ever changing FinTech landscape. He is a well respected thought leader, conference speaker and panellist for leading FinTech events such as Innovate Finance Global Summit, MEA FinTech Forum, and Euromoney. He is Chairman of Bank ABC in Jordan, Arab Financial Services Company, the ila advisory Panel and Vice Chairman of Bank ABC in Egypt. He has previously served on the Board of Banco ABC Brasil.

Schools Attended: Lafayette College, University of Pennsylvania Law School

Biography: Mustafa Hasan is a PhD holder in Computer Science with 21 years of experience in the field of technology specialist in complex compute data engine, fintech, and compliances, Mustafa worked in Balexco, Ahlia, AMA and advisory of some government entities, in parallel Mustafa was running many successful SME’s ALMADA, Bitrixme, Baitk, plugsky and helped consulting many reputed organizations like BBK, GulfAir, Zain, Stc, Bisb, KCB, NBB, Tamkeen, Alba and others, Also Mustafa a member in large organizations like CIO, PMO, Bcs, PCI Dss and Axelos, Currently venture to Exit and retire

Rima joined Mumtalakat in June 2013 and currently holds the position of Chief Operating Officer and Corporate Secretary. She is responsible for overseeing Mumtalakat’s Legal, Risk & Compliance, Information Technology and Administration divisions. As the Corporate Secretary, she also ensures the swift implementation and execution of Board of Directors’ directives. A legal advisor with comprehensive private practice and in-house experience gained over 17 years, in her capacity as Mumtalakat’s General Counsel until 2017, she managed the legal division’s activities, facilitating corporate and investment legal support while implementing the governance requirements of the organisation. She was instrumental in materialising over 15 local, regional and global investment transactions across various sectors. Most notably, Rima played a central role in the reorganisation of the McLaren Group. With her legal guidance, McLaren successfully consolidated its racing, automotive and technology businesses to promote further synergy between the three companies. Prior to moving to Bahrain, Rima held various roles in Australia including litigation solicitor of a specialist legal centre in New South Wales, where she convened and facilitated law reform submissions and presented them to the state, ministries and parliament. Rima sits on the Board of McLaren Group. She holds a LLB from Western Sydney University. She is an Australian qualified solicitor and a solicitor of the High Court of Australia.

Walid Majdalani joined Investcorp in 2007 from ABN AMRO Bank NV, where he spent close to ten years, mainly in private equity. In his last role, he was an Investment Director in a €1.1 billion third party infrastructure fund where he was involved in sourcing and closing a number of transactions globally.  Prior to this, Walid worked with Oracle Corporation in the UAE where he set up the Abu Dhabi office. Walid holds a BBA in Management Information Systems from the University of Texas and an MBA from Harvard University.
Schools Attended: Harvard University, The University of Texas at Austin

Biography: Verify Payments

Khalid Saad is the Chief Executive Officer of Bahrain FinTech Bay.   Previously, he was the  Business Development Manager for the Bahrain Economic Development Board, which is dynamic public agency that is responsible for attracting inward investment into Bahrain, enhancing the investment climate and driving economic development. He focused on promoting Bahrain's financial services sector and attracting new investments into this sector. Successes include expanding existing companies and attracting new ones such as banks, asset & wealth managers, insurers and ancillary services providers.   He also worked with existing financial players, financial associations, central bank, lawyers and others to drive development in the sector and make it more conducive and attractive for business. His most significant work to date was devising and implementing a countrywide strategy to drive the growth of the sector through a collaborative approach with key players in the sector.   Before joining the Bahrain Economic Development Board, he worked for Ernst & Young where his work centered on conducting feasibility and market studies, operations plans, strategic documents and private placement memorandums for a wide array of clients. He also led the implementation of a governance, risk and compliance platform in the Bahrain office and trained all advisory. ​ Prior to that, he worked in SEI Investments in London focusing on UK and European Equities within the Investment Management Unit.
Schools Attended: Imperial College London, University of Exeter

Primary Job Title: Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer – Retail Banking
Biography: kground Mr. Abdulla Ahmed Al-Raeesi serves as Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Retail Banking at Commercial Bank of Iraq PSC. Mr. Al-Raeesi serves as Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Retail Banking at Ahli United Bank B.S.C. and Ahli Bank Q.S.C. (alternative name Legal & General Gulf B.S.C.). Mr. Al-Raeesi serves as the Head of Business & Technology Consulting at Arthur Andersen. He serves as an Assistant General Manager and Head of Delivery Channels at Commercial Bank, Qatar and Assistant General Manager of Support Group at Doha Bank, Qatar. Mr. Al-Raeesi served as Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Retail & Private Banking at Ahli Bank S.A.O.G. He served as Acting Chief Executive Officer of Ahli Bank, Qatar. He served as Acting Chief Executive Officer of Ahli Bank, Qatar; Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Retail Banking, AUB Bahrain. Mr. Al-Raeesi has been Non-Executive Director at Ahli United Bank K.S.C.P. since March 2015 and Legal & General Gulf B.S.C., Qatar. He has been a Member of the Board of Legal & General Takaful B.S.C.(c), Bahrain since March 2009. He served as a Director of Benefit Company, Bahrain, Ahli Bank Q.S.C. and International Chamber of Commerce, Bahrain.

Hisham Al Rayes is the Chief Executive Officer as well as the member of the Board of Directors of GFH Financial Group, one of the regional leading financial groups with USD 6.2 billion assets and fund under management and shares listed in the Kingdom of Bahrain, Dubai and Kuwait. In 2012, Mr. Al Rayes assumed leadership of the firm with an objective to establish a diverse and well-recognized regional financial group offering a remarkable platform for Wealth Management, Real Estate, Commercial Banking and Asset Management. Prior to his role as the Group’s CEO, Mr. Al Rayes was GFH’s Chief Investment Officer during which he was responsible for driving the development and execution of its regional and international investment strategy along with management of the bank’s liabilities.

Primary Job Title: Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Risk, Legal and Compliance
Biography: Keith H. Gale is Associate Member at Institute of Chartered Accountants in England & Wales, Deputy Group CEO-Risk, Legal & Compliance at Ahli United Bank (Egypt) SAE and Deputy Group CEO-Risk, Legal & Compliance at Ahli United Bank BSC. He is on the Board of Directors at Ahli United Bank, Ahli United Bank UK Plc, AUB Investments (Cyrpus) Ltd. and Ahli Bank SAOG. Mr. Gale was previously employed as Head-Credit & Risk by ABC International Bank Plc (Bahrain) and Vice President-Internal Audit by Arab Banking Corp. BSC. He received his undergraduate degree from Lancaster University.

Current Organizations: Bahrain Economic Development Board, Mubadala Capital | Ventures US

Biography: Paul Scott joined Mumtalakat in April 2018 as Chief Investment Officer. With a successful track record of building, repositioning and successfully growing scale business units in the investment arena, he is responsible for implementing and executing Mumtalakat’s investment strategy and ensuring the long-term growth of its portfolio of assets.  He holds a BSc in Business and Management Studies from University of Salford and is an Associate of the Chartered Institute of Bankers (ACIB).

Primary Job Title: Head of Treasury Operations and Corporate Accounting
Biography: Ayman Al-Arrayed joined Investcorp in 2006 and is deputy head of operations & corporate accounting. Before Investcorp, Ayman worked at Remza Investment, a regional GGC investment company based in Bahrain where he was deputy Managing Director. Ayman holds a Masters in E-Business from Middlesex University, UK and a BSc in Management and Business Administration from the University of Bahrain.

Nemir Kirdar is the Founder, Executive Chairman and CEO of the global investment group, Investcorp, which operates out of New York, London, Bahrain, Riyadh and Abu Dhabi. Mr. Kirdar began his banking career in New York in 1969. Following two years of credit training, he covered South East Asia and Japan for Allied Bank International. In 1974 he joined The Chase Manhattan Bank, New York, as Vice President. Between 1976 and 1981 he served in the Arabian Gulf overseeing and directing Chase's banking network in the region. He founded Investcorp in 1982. Investcorp specializes in offering multi-product alternative investments on both sides of the Atlantic. These include direct investments in unquoted corporate entities, hedge funds, real estate and Gulf growth capital. The firm's mission is to act as a bridge between surplus funds in the Gulf and non-traditional investment opportunities in the US and Western Europe. Its 300 staff are drawn from over 30 nationalities. Mr. Kirdar graduated in Economics from the University of the Pacific in California and holds an MBA from Fordham University in New York. He has also completed Harvard Business School's Senior Management Program. Mr. Kirdar has been awarded an honorary Doctorate in Humane Letters from Georgetown University, Washington D.C.; an honorary Doctorate in Laws from the University of the Pacific, California; and an honorary Doctorate in Economics from Richmond, the American International University in London.  With his interests in business and geopolitics, Mr. Kirdar has spoken at various international forums. He is also the author of numerous articles and three published books - "Saving Iraq" (2009), which reviews Iraq's history and maps a course for its future restoration; "In Pursuit of Fulfilment" (2012) which records his life journey; and "Need Respect Trust" (2013) which tells the story of Investcorp.

Nabeel Almoayed is the founder and main shareholder in Almoayed Group. Mr. Almoayed has been leading the company since its inception in Bahrain in 1982, and has grown it into the Group that currently expands across 7 countries. His role has been instrumental in the Group, and includes setting corporate strategy, identifying new market and geographies to operate in. Mr. Almoayed obtained his Bachelors degree in Biochemistry from American University of Beirut, Lebanon.

Abderrahmane Mounir has over 18 years of experience in the telecommunications and IT industry, working in different markets where he gained extensive experience in the executive management of sales, marketing, operations and end-to-end customer experience. Before joining Batelco, Abderrahmane was a vice-president and member of the executive committee in charge of the enterprise and wholesale segments at MEDITELECOM – an Orange subsidiary operating in Morocco. His role incorporated the management of the field sales force, product and services delivery and also wholesale data, roaming and international P&L. Included in his achievements were the development and launch of corporate and SMB offers. Earlier, Abderrahmane spent 10 years with Cisco Systems and held the post of general manager of Cisco’s operation in Morocco from 2006 to 2008. Abderrahmane holds an engineering degree in Telecommunication from INPT Morocco and a Bachelor of Science in Computer and Electrical Engineering from Wichita State University, Kansas, USA.

Karan Ponnudurai joined the Batelco Group in July 2016 taking on the newly created role of Group Chief Digital Officer to support the Group’s strategy to be a leader in the growing field of digitisation.  With over 25 years’ experience gained in leading organisations in the US, Germany and Malaysia, Karan has the relevant knowledge and experience to meet Batelco Group’s commitment to delivering the digital solutions required for the growth of smart cities and smart businesses. Prior to joining the Batelco Group, Karan held the post of Chief Innovation Officer at Axiata Digital, Malaysia, with responsibility for the digital strategy, implementation and on-going business operations of the company across a number of geographies. He previously held senior executive roles including the post of Senior Vice President at Celcom Axiata and Vice President Technology & Business Development at SBEM, Kuala Lumpur. Karan holds a BSc in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University, USA and a Master of Engineering with specialisation in Communication Systems from University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur.

Schools Attended: Babson College, San Francisco State University, Zhejiang University

Biography: Dr. Khalid Al Khalifa joined Batelco as General Manager of Cyber & Corporate Security in January 2018. He has extensive experience in managing Cyber Security and communications intelligence programmes with a proven track record of successfully executing complex nationwide security initiatives that have resulted in significant improvements in the Kingdom of Bahrain’s Cyber Security posture, and global cyber readiness rankings. Due to his dedicated efforts he has been recognised as one of the top 100 Cyber Security Leaders in the Middle East at the CISO Awards 2016. Dr. Khalid has headed several high profile delegations representing the Kingdom and the Telecom sector at key events such as US Command – Central Region Communications Conference, US-GCC Strategic Cooperation Forum (Cyber), and ITU – Global Forum on Emergency Telecommunications, among others. Dr. Khalid holds a Diploma in Military Leadership (UK) and amongst other degrees, a Doctorate in International Relations (Switzerland).

Hard-working, ambitious and motivated, Fatima is an Undergraduate student from the University of Bahrain with a degree in Business Management and a minor degree in Finance. She is currently the Business Development Manager at Obai & Hill with a demonstrated history of working in the public relations and communications industry. She is skilled in Public Speaking, Time Management, and Client relations. In addition, she is also the Project Manager of the Women Power Summit with experience in project planning, events management, logistics coordination, and B2B partnerships
CEO at Skiplino.

Primary Job Title: Head of Fintech and Innovation Unit
Biography: “Yasmeen Al-Sharaf is Heading the FinTech & Innovation Unit at the Central Bank of Bahrain (“CBB”), tasked with setting up a conducive ecosystem to facilitate a robust regulatory framework that fosters innovation within the financial services sector. She has been working with the CBB for the past 13 years were she held the post of ‘Superintendent – Licensing Research & Development’ within the Licensing Director at the Central Bank of Bahrain (CBB) for 7 years. Prior to that she was a Senior Analyst within the same Directorate. During the time spent within the Licensing Directorate, Yasmeen got to work closely with banks, investment companies, insurance companies, financing companies and ancillary service provider both local and international, as well as gaining insight and a thorough understanding of Bahrain’s regulatory framework governing all sectors within the financial services industry. Prior to joining the CBB, Yasmeen worked briefly at Bahrain Islamic Bank within the Corporate Finance Department. Yasmeen also sits on multiple committees handling different key initiatives revolving around FinTech & Innovation, including but not limited to being the Vice Chairman of the Regulatory Sandbox Applications Committee at the CBB and a member of the Women in FinTech Bahrain Committee. She has also been selected as one of the “Top 100 Women in FinTech 2019” by Lattice80 Hub in collaboration with Miss Kaya. She holds a Bachelor’s of Science in Banking and Finance from the University of Bahrain.

Parag Bhave is the Chief Executive Officer at Almoayed Group WLL. He has over 25 years of extensive international experience in Business Strategy, Mergers & Acquisitions, Business Development, Sales & Marketing, Customer Services and Business Operations within the ICT and Technology related industries.His core strengths has been managing independent businesses, spearheading complete business administration, and controlling P&L’s. He has previously handled various strategic level leadership roles which include heading business operations in Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific regions while managing large number of professionals at regional and global level. Mr Bhave holds a Bachelor’s in Electronic Engineering with specialization in Telecommunications.

With over 28 years of diversified experience in the areas of operations, audit, and risk in the banking industry, Anantha Narayanan joined SICO in 2008. He was Head of Internal Audit before being appointed to his current role of Chief Operating Officer. Prior to joining SICO, he worked for Credit Agricole Corporate & Investment Bank, BBK, Commercial Bank of Oman/Bank Muscat, and PricewaterhouseCoopers. Anantha is a Chartered Accountant and Cost Accountant (India), a Certified Information Systems Auditor and Financial Risk Manager (USA), and an Associate Member of the Institute of Financial Studies (UK). He holds a BSc Honours from the University of Manchester, UK.

Primary Job Title: Executive Director – Business Development -Manufacturing, Transport & Logistics

Biography: Michael Merritt is one of the founding partners of Investcorp. He joined Investcorp in 1981 from Chase Manhattan Bank where he had spent 13 years in several positions, the last of which being Senior Credit and Marketing Officer for the company's Gulf division. Michael spent 15 years at Investcorp before leaving in 1996 to become a self-directed trader of equities and financial futures. At the time that he left Investcorp, Michael was a Co-Chief Operating Officer. Michael returned to Investcorp as Chief Administrative Officer in 2011. Michael holds an MBA in Finance and a BSc in Management, both from New York University.

Primary Job Title: Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer of Corporate Banking
Biography: Derek Lunt is a Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer-Corporate Banking at Ahli United Bank BSC.

Shaun Hill joined Investcorp in 2004 as head of internal audit. For the last five years, Shaun was chief internal auditor at Union National Bank in Abu Dhabi.  Before then, he was a senior audit manager with Riyadh Bank in Saudi Arabia and previously a member of the internal audit team at American Express in the UK. Shaun has also been a senior manager with Deloitte & Touche. Shaun holds a BSc in computer science from Staffordshire University and an MBA from Warwick University. He is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales.  Shaun is also a CFA Charterholder.

Mufeed Rajab joined Investcorp in 2003 from JP Morgan Chase Bank where he worked for 24 years, 16 of which were spent in their Bahrain office as Vice President - head of operations, human resources, finance, technology and administration.  The remaining eight years were spent in their Toronto office as Vice President - head of operations, technology and general administration. Mufeed holds a Bachelor of Commerce in Accounting and Statistics from the University of Karnataka, India and a Diploma in Banking Studies from the Bahrain Institute of Banking and Finance.

Omar Barakat is the Value Creation Lead at BECO Capital. Omar spent a year traveling across the Middle East and North Africa as a Seedstars Associate, scouting, coaching and investing in early-stage tech entrepreneurs in the region. He obtained an MSc in Management Science (Behavioural Science) from the London School of Economics, and a BSc in Economics and Management from the University of Bristol. Being a strong believer in the impact of technology and entrepreneurship on peoples’ lives in MENA, Omar is passionate about adding value to startups and accelerating their growth.

Nawaf Almoayed joined Almoayed Group WLL in the capacity of Director-Technical in January 2009. His role covers overseeing all technical aspects and ensuring implementation of quality technical standards within the Group. Prior to his position with Almoayed Group, Dr. Almoayed was studying towards his PhD in Electrical Engineering at Tufts University, Boston, USA, which he completed in the summer of 2008. His main areas of concentration are in the fields of microwave engineering and wireless communication, and he has published numerous technical papers in the microwave field. He also holds B.S. and M.S. degrees in electrical engineering from Tufts University.

Ali Adel is an Bahraini Actor. He is known for playing in the historical drama Bab al-Hara season 1-7, which is shown in months of Ramadan, in which he plays Khader. The shooting of Bab Al-Hara runs in Damascus.

Primary Job Title: Deputy General Manager, Non-Financial Services Division

Biography: Rasheed Mohamed Al Maraj has been Governor of the Central Bank of Bahrain (CBB), previously the Bahrain Monetary Agency (BMA), since January 2005. As Governor, Mr. Al Maraj carries ministerial ranking and is the chief executive of the CBB, which is responsible for ensuring monetary and financial stability in Bahrain. The CBB is also the single regulator of Bahrain’s financial services industry. Mr. Al Maraj has a wealth of experience in finance, engineering and management and has served with the Government and the private sector. His career highlights include senior positions with Government, having served as Assistant Under-Secretary at the then Finance and National Economy Ministry and Under-Secretary at the Ministry of Transportation. Prior to his appointment as CBB Governor, Mr. Al Maraj was General Manager and Chief Executive Officer of the Arab Petroleum Investments Corporation (Apicorp), which is based in Dammam, Saudi Arabia. Currently, Mr. Al Maraj is on the Boards of the Economic Development Board (EDB), National Oil and Gas Authority (NOGA) and member of the Board of Trustees of the Oxford Institute for Energy Studies, UK. He has previously served as Chairman of the Bahrain Telecommunications Company, a member of the Consultation Council of the Co-operation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf and the Telecommunications Regulatory Authority (TRA) of Bahrain.

Ebrahim Al Sayed leads the Customer Experience team to ensure the best experience for Batelco’s valued customers. Prior to this role, Ebrahim held the role of General Manager Consumer Division. Ebrahim joined Batelco in 1992 and over the years has held various managerial roles in Marketing Communications, Sales Channels, Product Development and Product Management. Throughout more than 25 years at Batelco, he has gained vast experience in mobile communications and marketing & business development fields. Also, Ebrahim has led and contributed in many milestones, such as the transition of mobile technology from 2G to 3G, the introduction of LTE services, establishing and growing the roaming business through utilizing the latest technologies in addition to many other major projects.

Current Organizations: Archi & Luxury Middle East SPC, Italian Contracting Middle East LLC, Roma Trading FZE
Biography: Visionary entrepreneur,  quick decision maker and strong calculator

Primary Job Title: Managing Director - Head of Financial Management

Biography: Kevin is currently the Group Chief Investment Officer at Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo and Executive GM of Kanoo Capital, the investment division of the company.  YBA Kanoo is one of the largest and oldest diversified family conglomerates in the GCC. Kevin has worked with YBA Kanoo for four years and had over 19 years’ experience in the GCC and over 29 years’ global experience in the areas of investment management, treasury and funding engagements including YBA Kanoo, Dubai World, Investcorp and Citibank.  Kevin has extensive experience in investment management including investment strategy, asset allocation, alternative investments, listed securities, risk management and performance attribution. He has advised on capital structures, arranged capital raisings, developed complex financing options and negotiated restructurings.  He has all-encompassing experience in driving a broad range of diversified debt, equity and liquidity initiatives in global markets.

Primary Job Title: Deputy Group Chief Executive Officer - Operations and Technology
Biography: Mustafa S. Anwar is Deputy Group CEO-Operations & Technology at Ahli United Bank BSC. He is on the Board of Directors at Ahli Bank SAOG. Primary Job Title: Managing Director & Head of Corporate Communications
Biography: Firas El Amine joined Investcorp in 2007 from Dubai Holding where he was the Corporate Communications Director. Prior to this, he worked with Alsalam Holding, Beirut as a Communications and Public Relations Director and with Impact & Echo, Kuwait as a Public Relations Director. Firas holds a Masters degree in Political Science from Lebanese American University and a bachelors degree in Communication Arts from Beirut University College.
Hassan holds a PhD in Theoretical Particle Physics and a MSc in Quantitative Mathematical Finance, both from the University of Wisconsin in Madison, USA.

Mohammed Al Fahad is a seasoned entrepreneur with a passion for tech-startups & disruptive technology. He started his career teaching Statistics & Quantative Business Analytics at the University of San Francisco, California, as a TA during his Undergrad studies where he double majored in Accounting & Business Management. In the Summer of 2012, Mohammed moved back from San Francisco-CA to The Kingdom of Bahrain, and spent the rest of the year doing volunteer work for the United Nations Industrial Development Program (UNIDO) as a Business Counselor; teaching new entrepreneurs business strategy, financial modeling, marketing & resource planning. Come 2013, Mohammed moved to EAG Group as a Business Development Officer, a Multi-National Group of Companies with investments in Real Estate, Construction, Steel Manufacturing, Security Systems, Commodity Trade and other sectors. He spent time learning and refining each subsidiary in the group, as well as developing new projects and partnerships, especially in ICT. In late 2013, Mohammed received a seed investment from EAG to build & manage a new Tech Holding Company, Nayzaq Technologies Co. to develop a global partnership network of Tech Companies interested in doing business in the Middle East. Projects accomplished included clients such as Bahrain Airport Services (BAS), Regional Banks and Int’l Hotel Chains. Nayzaq gradually moved from building partnerships/agencies to developing their own in-house SAAS Technologies. In 2016 he was promoted to become President of EAG and develop their International Business Operations, managing International Investments & Finance Projects in Infrastructure, Energy and Real Estate. Late 2018, Mohammed decided to step out of his Executive position in EAG to develop a new globally disruptive venture in the Tech space. After months of R&D the vision was completely conceptualized and in early 2019 Mohammed finally founded “Qongfu: The Fitness Social Network & Marketplace”. The company ran a stealth operation for months, meeting clients, partaking in Sports Events, refining the POC and implementing Prototype Testing. On Oct 1st 2020 Qongfu announced its Beta release to the Bahrain App Store. Stay tuned for further announcements on Qongfu releases and disruptive-packed action!
Schools Attended: University of San Francisco School of Management

Biography: Suha joined Mumtalakat in September 2014 and currently holds the role of Chief Financial Officer, overseeing the Finance, Treasury and Capital Markets functions. As the Chief Financial Officer, Suha is currently responsible for implementing effective financial policies and controls, financial reporting to relevant stakeholders in addition to developing, implementing and managing an optimal capital structures that effectively meet short term liquidity needs and long term strategic objectives. Suha is a board member in Aluminium Bahrain (Alba). She is a Certified Public Accountant, and holds a BSc in Accounting from the University of Bahrain. Prior to holding this role, Suha was Chief Operating Officer, with the responsibility of overseeing Mumtalakat’s corporate functions including Legal, Risk Management, Human Resources and Administration, and Information Technology. She was also responsible for corporate governance practices at Mumtalakat, and ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements where needed. With over 20 years of experience in finance and accounting, audit, advisory and statutory reporting services, Suha’s industry exposure includes Financial Services, Insurance and the Public Sector. Prior to joining Mumtalakat, she held the role of Vice President, Finance and Support at Tamkeen (Labour Fund), where she was responsible for Tamkeen’s internal operating units, including Finance, Human Resources, Legal and Information Technology. Formerly, she held different managerial positions at KPMG International working within the Audit and Advisory Units in Bahrain, Qatar, and the United States.

Faisal Al-Jalahma is responsible for developing Batelco’s HR strategy with a focus on employee centricity and transforming Batelco to be Bahrain’s employer of choice. Faisal began his career with Batelco as a graduate trainee in the HR Department where he gained wide experience and knowledge of all aspects of the HR field. Having worked at Batelco prior to and following the introduction of competition, and being involved in major projects related to key operational changes, greatly broadened Faisal’s skills. In 2012, Faisal moved to the Telecommunications Regulatory Authority (TRA), held various roles and last was the Director of Finance, Information Technology and Human Resources. The role included transformational HR projects to digitalise and automate the support function processes at the TRA including in HR and Finance. The diverse scope of his role prepared him well for his return to Batelco. Faisal holds an MBA from the University of Strathclyde, UK and several executive qualifications from Harvard Business School and Harvard University, John F. Kennedy School of Government.

Fatima Mohamed Albalooshi is the Kingdom’s longest-serving female minister, and the first minister to simultaneously oversee three portfolios – Social Development, Health and Human Rights. While serving in government, Dr. Albalooshi’s accomplishments included the launch of a range of social services targeting the poor, elderly, disabled and other disadvantaged members of society, as well as the founding and chairing of the world’s first Islamic microfinance bank, Bahrain-based Family Bank, which seeks to empower small entrepreneurs. She was also a member of the Economic Development Board’s Executive Committee from 2008 to 2011, and of the Consultative Commission for the Supreme Council of GCC Leaders from 2004 to 2005. In recognition of her achievements, Dr. Albalooshi was awarded the Bahrain Medal Dr. Albalooshi has been a member of the Supreme Council for Women since 2001, having been appointed personally by His Majesty King Hamad. Also serving as Chairperson of Bahrain Trust Foundation, a non-profit organization offering empowerment through education, training and health services, Dr. Albalooshi continues to be passionate about humanitarianism, women’s rights and community development, supporting projects that improve the quality of life of Bahrain’s people.

Tony Robinson is Investcorp’s Chief Financial Officer. He is also a member of the Firm’s Operating Committee Tony has over 35 years of corporate finance and professional accounting experience across Australia, the UK and Bahrain. Tony joined Investcorp in 1994 as a senior manager in Financial Controls and became Investcorp’s Chief Internal Auditor in 1998. In his capacity as Group Financial Controller (2004-2008), Tony led a team of finance professionals across three geographic locations (London, New York and Bahrain). Tony rejoined Investcorp in 2015 as Chief Financial Officer, from Bahrain Mumtalakat Holding Co. where he managed the investment support and coordination team before becoming Mumtalakat’s Chief Financial Officer from 2012.  As Investcorp’s Chief Financial Officer, Tony’s responsibilities include financial control and reporting, balance sheet management, investment administration, corporate accounting, group treasury support and operations. Tony holds a Bachelor of Business in accounting from the Western Australia Institute of Technology and a Master of Taxation from Curtin University, Australia. He is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales and the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Australia.

Esra’a Al-Shafei is a Bahraini civil rights activist, blogger, and the founder and executive director of Mideast Youth and its related projects, including CrowdVoice.org. Al-Shafei is a senior TED Fellow,an Echoing Green fellow, and has been referred to by CNN reporter George Webster as “An outspoken defender of free speech”.[5] She has been featured in FastCompany as one of the “100 Most Creative People in Business.”In 2011, The Daily Beast listed Al-Shafei as one of the 17 bravest bloggers worldwide. She is also a promoter of music as a means of social change, and founded Mideast Tunes, which is currently the largest platform for underground musicians in the Middle East and North Africa. Al-Shafei is a recipient of the Berkman Award for Internet Innovation from Berkman Center for Internet & Society at Harvard Law School in 2008 for “outstanding contributions to the internet and its impact on society.” In 2012, she received a Shuttleworth Foundation Fellowship for her work on the open source platform CrowdVoice.org. She is also the recipient of the Monaco Media Prize, which acknowledges innovative uses of media for the betterment of humanity. In 2014, she was featured in Forbes‘ “30 Under 30” list of social entrepreneurs making an impact in the world. The World Economic Forum listed her as one of “15 Women Changing the World in 2015.”

Wafa is the Chief Executive Officer and Creative Director of Obai and Hill. In 2015, Obai and Hill received the Start-Up of the Year award, hosted by the Bahrain Entrepreneurship Awards. Wafa is also a Shaper in the Global Shapers Community, a network of city-based Hubs developed and led by young leaders between 20 and 30 years old who want to develop their leadership potential to better serve society. Wafa is a committee member of the SME Society in the Bahrain Chamber of Commerce. Wafa is a Feature Contributor to Start Up Bahrain, an award-winning independent publication for startups and entrepreneurship, and a columnist at Khaleejesque Magazine where she writes about startups, design, and the creative industry in the Middle East.

DJ Outlaw (Mohammed Al Mohri) was born and raised in Bahrain, and is the founding member of Outlaw Productions creative studio. His DJ career started in 1997, but it was 2009 before he released his debut studio album History in the Making, featuring many local and international artists. It was the first Bahraini hip-hop album to be distributed in musical outlets across the country as well as being sold on digital distribution platforms including iTunes and Amazon. His annual mixtape series “The Middle East Invasion” (which is currently on volume six) presents Arab artitsts handpicked by Outlaw so that the world can experience what Arabian hip-hop has to offer. Most recently Outlaw joined Radio Bahrain 96.5FM in October of 2016 and is now hosting his own Hiphop/RnB drive time show every Friday. Outlaw has been producing music since 2003. “Bahrain Unite” and 2011’s “Arab World Unite” were two of his biggest projects so far – the latter, featuring seven artists from around the Arab world, was released on Saudi hip-hop artist Qusai’s album, and both tracks garnered international media attention. In 2014, the hit single “Samboosa” – produced by Outlaw and performed by Kuwaiti Outlaw Productions artist, Daffy – quickly went viral, bagging 100,000 views on YouTube within a week of the video release. In July 2016, 9ARAT, a collaborative album between Outlaw Productions artists Flipperachi and Daffy produced by DJ Outlaw, was released, claiming the Number One spot on the iTunes MENA charts. The video for one of the album’s singles “EE LAA” was released in July 2016, and now has over 10 million YouTube views. The single also reached Number One on the iTunes MENA general and hip-hop charts. Outlaw has also worked with artists including G-unit, DJ Lord Sear, MC Lyte, Jaz O, The Outlawz, TQ, Ace Hood, Freeway, Mad Skillz, Fatman Scoop and actor Orlando Jones. He has shared a stage with DJ Jazzy Jeff, DJ Tony Touch, Junior Jack, Yves Larock, Fatman Scoop, DJ KOOL, Shortie Blitz, Just Blaze, Tabu of the Black Eyed Peas, and most recently, DMC of RUN DMC.

Christopher Mangaliman is a Sales Executive at ThinkSmart.

With a background firmly rooted in engineering and business management, Mahmood Alkooheji has been at the helm of the Kingdom of Bahrain’s sovereign wealth fund, Mumtalakat, since 2012. His leadership sparked the fund’s transformation into a profitable organisation as he oversaw the growth and diversification of its portfolio with strategic acquisitions in Europe and the USA. Today it is recognised as one of the most transparent sovereign wealth funds in the world. Alkooheji holds a BEng in Mechanical Engineering from Staffordshire University and a MBA from Henley College of Management, Brunel University. His career has spanned the public sector with a focus on industrial and commercial investments. As the Chairman of Alba (Aluminium Bahrain) between 2008 and 2014, he spearheaded the company’s restructuring and the successful listing of 10% of its shares on both the London and Bahrain stock exchanges. Similarly, as the Chairman of Gulf Air between 2007 and 2008, he launched the airline’s single-ownership restructuring programme. His history within the Ministry of Finance is noteworthy as he administered the privatisation of key public assets in his years as the Director of Government Shareholding, developing the national privatisation policy. This was further enhanced in his continued capacities as Assistant Undersecretary through which he supported the Economic Development Board’s efforts to establish Mumtalakat. In recognition of his public service to the Kingdom, Alkooheji is the recipient of a number of honours. Most notably, he was awarded the Order of Shaikh Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa, 4th Class in 2000 and the Order of Achievement, 1st Class by HM King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa in 2012. A Chevalier of the Légion d’honneur, the highest decoration in France, he represents Mumtalakat on the boards of important Bahrain-based companies in addition to the McLaren Group and McLaren Automotive.

Wafeeq Ajoor [IEEE-M’1999/SM’2009] (wajoor@ieee.org) is a Chief Information and Communication Officer (CICO). He has received his B.Sc. in Computer Engineering from the King Saud University, KSA, in 1991, his M.Sc. in Electronics Engineering (Communications) from the University of Wales, UK, in 1993, and his M.A.Sc. in Electrical and Computer Engineering (Wireless/Mobile Communications) from the University of Waterloo, Canada, in 2003. He also obtained a diploma in Training and Development from the Thames Valley University, UK, in 1996. In 1991, he worked for IBM as a Mainframe Customers Care Engineer for 3 years. He worked for the University of Bahrain as a Computer Science Lecturer in 1996 for 2 years. He worked for Enbridge Consumer Gas Inc. (Canada) as a Wireless Consultant, in 2001, and for V Technology (Canada) as a Hardware Design Testing Engineer in 2002. He worked for the Ministry of Transportation as a Telecommunications Engineer in 2004, for FCCI-Bahrain as a 2G/3G Radio Planning & Optimization Engineer, and for Nokia Network)-Nigeria/West Africa/Kuwait as a Senior Key Account Manager in 2009 for 3 years. He is currently working for National Health Regularity Authority (NHRA) as an Executive IT Advisor/Consultant (‘CTO’). He is the recipient of the prestigious Canadian Wireless Telecommunications Association (CWTA) award in 2001. He served as a Local Arrangements Committee Chair of the 2nd IEEE-GCC Electrical and Electronics Industries Conference, Nov. 23-25, 2004. He delivered 2 tutorials titled: “WiMAX: The Broadband Wireless Access Technology”, at 4th IEEE-GCC Conference & Exhibition, Kingdom of Bahrain, Nov. 11th, 2007 and “LTE Long Term Evolution (LTE): The New Broadband Contender”, at 6th IEEE-GCC Conference & Exhibition, UAE, Feb. 19th, 2012. He has been a reviewer for the IEEE Communications magazine and Wiley’s Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing journal. His current research interest is 5G Mobile/Wireless Communications (IoT/M2M/Smart-Healthcare).
